6.41.text: For me, walking as an activity just ticks all the boxes.

10.40.text: It's free, it's relaxing and therapeutic if I'm by myself

14.81.text: and if I've got the kids with me, well it's just perfect family time.

18.61.text: The kids can go off and make a den or play hide-and-seek

22.26.text:
my husband can immerse himself in
photography and I can just

25.75.text: sit back and watch the wildlife. Autumn

28.77.text:
is such a good time because we can
collect conkers, we can feast on blackberries

33.44.text: and we can collect chestnuts and take them home and roast them over the fire.

36.92.text: I think the big thing about autumn is just the colours of

39.99.text: the trees. Every tree is a different colour, it's one of my favourite seasons,

45.06.text: Go and see how far you can skim a stone, how many conkers you can

49.09.text: collect and all those sorts of things and do it with your kids

52.48.text: If you can enjoy it, the kid can enjoy it.

54.14.text: Explore natures playground. Go and find a big

57.22.text:
tree that the children can climb and you
can just sit under for a moment and

60.93.text: enjoy the scenery. Or an old stump where they can go and play king of the castle.

64.65.text:
and collect some beautiful autumnal
leaves in a shaded gold and bronze and copper

70.33.text: and take them home to make a collage and just enjoy the great British countryside.

75.28.text: There are National Trust places all over the country

77.46.text: so there's no excuse not to go out and have a lovely walk.
